title: Hilary Duff looks casual chic in destroyed denim and felt hat as she runs errands with her kids
text:
She just went bleach blonde for the upcoming reboot of Lizzie McGuire.

But on Saturday, it was her kids' turn to change up their looks as they were spotted shopping for Halloween costumes in Los Angeles.

Hilary Duff, 32, was seen carrying her 1-year-old daughter Banks while son Luca, 7, held mom's arm as he walked beside them.

Weekend warrior: Hilary Duff, 32, was seen carrying her 1-year-old daughter Banks while son Luca, 7, held mom's arm during the Saturday errand run in Los Angeles

Duff looked casual chic for the weekend outing.

She donned a white v-neck with destroyed denim jeans and a stylish felt hat.

The Younger star further accessorized with a brown belt, retro round shades and gold jewelry.

Duff swept her new platinum blonde locks back into an updo, hidden by her hipster headwear.

Mom on the go: Duff donned a white v-neck with destroyed denim jeans and a stylish felt hat

On her feet she sported black and white sequin Fendi slip ons.

The A Cinderella Story star was later seen pushing a stroller while a black crossbody bag hung over her chest.

Duff is currently in the middle of two projects, as filming on Younger just wrapped for the season and her reprisal Lizzie McGuire of was just announced in August.

Though it's not slated to be released until 2020, the star recently lightened her hair in preparation for the upcoming reboot, and her hairstylist, Nikki Lee, took to Instagram to share a photo of the results.

Blondie! Hilary swept her new platinum blonde locks back into an updo, hidden by her hipster headwear

'Never in a million years did I think I would be doing Lizzie’s color!' she wrote in the caption.

'Well dreams do come true! Thank you @hilaryduff for trusting me to create the perfect blonde for the next chapter of Lizzie Mcguire!'

In the new Lizzie McGuire series, Duff will play an older and wiser version of her character from the early-2000s Disney Channel show.

Lizzie will return to the small-screen as a 30-year-old who works as an apprentice to an NYC decorator.

She's back! Though it's not slated to be released until 2020, the star recently lightened her hair in preparation for the upcoming reboot, and her hairstylist, Nikki Lee, took to Instagram to share a photo of the results

After the show was announced, Duff told People that she felt it was the 'right' time for the show to come back, since the stages of life that Lizzie and target audiences would be in coincide with one another.

'The conversations have gone on for a couple of years and the timing just didn’t seem right and now Lizzie is turning 30,' she said.

'For me, she was everybody’s best friend and she was there for us… entering your 30s is a really big deal.'

'I think it’s the right time to set back in and have her go along with you in your 30s and all the fun times, and all of the big monumental moments, and all of the challenges that you’re faced with,' she said.
